resources.string: Bakery. Choose from a wide range of desserts by the famous French chef,Cyril Lignac.
Tuesday to Friday 10 am to 7 pm Saturday and Sunday 9 am to 7 pm
La Pâtisserie, 33 rue de Sèvres 75006 Paris
Specialised in Turkish and Middle-eastern delicacies.
58 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
L\'As du Fallafel is a Kosher Middle Eastern restaurant located at 34, Rue des Rosiers in the Pletzl Jewish quarter of the Le Marais neighborhood in Paris, France
58 Rue du Faubourg Saint-Denis, 75010 Paris, France
It is an ice cream place famous for it heavenly ice creams.
9-31 Rue Saint-Louis en l\'Île, 75004 Paris, France
Angelina is known primarily for its almost pudding-like hot chocolate and for its Mont Blanc dessert
It is a thrift shop for great and cheap stuff to buy.
Mo-Fr 11:30 AM to 8:30 PM. Sa-Su 1 PM to 8:30 PM
Vast choice of records, home of the rock and roll punk in Paris.
It is a souvenir store in Paris. Go buy yourself a memento to remind you of Paris for a long time.
Amazing liquor place to taste and try anything to everything alcohol.
7 Place de la Madeleine, 75008 Paris, France
The Eiffel Tower is a wrought iron lattice tower on the Champ de Mars in Paris, France. It is named after the engineer Gustave Eiffel, whose company designed and built the tower.
Champ de Mars, 5 Avenue Anatole France, 75007 Paris, France

The Arc de Triomphe de l\'Étoile, Triumphal Arch of the Star) is one of the most famous monuments in Paris, standing at the western end of the Champs-Élysées at the center of Place Charles de Gaulle, formerly named Place de l\'Étoile — the étoile or star of the juncture formed by its twelve radiating avenues.
Place Charles de Gaulle, 75008 Paris, France
$13 for adults and free for children
6 Parvis Notre-Dame - Pl. Jean-Paul II, 75004 Paris, France
Notre-Dame de Paris, also known as Notre-Dame Cathedral or simply Notre-Dame, is a medieval Catholic cathedral on the Île de la Cité in the fourth arrondissement of Paris, France.
Right Bank of the Seine in the city\'s 1st arrondissement, Paris, France
$10 for everyone except first Sundays of month when it is free
The Louvre, or the Louvre Museum, is the world\'s largest art museum and a historic monument in Paris, France. A central landmark of the city.
$12 for guided tours, free for children under 10

The Palace of Versailles was the principal residence of the Kings of France from Louis XIV in 1682 until the beginning of the French Revolution in 1789. It is located in the city of Versailles, which is 49 minutes drive from Paris.
Rent a pocket WI-FI to have internet access everywhere. It is convenient while travelling as most of the hotels have limited internet access.

Did you forget your toothpaste? Are you jet-lagged and need a coffee 3 AM? You need a Supérette Beaumarchais, a convenience store that is open from 8 AM to 5 AM. Here you will find from food and drinks, to first necessity products.

The Paris Visite Pass (Travelcard) is included free in the Paris Pass package and is valid to use for journeys in central Paris on the Metro, RER, Buses, Trams and SNCF. Together with our free downloadable Metro Map,and free pocket guidebook, you can navigate the city with ease making your sightseeing even easier and cost-effective. What do you get with the Paris Visite Pass? 1. Unlimited Travel across Central Paris - you can travel at any time of the day, any day of the week 2. Access to all Paris Transport Networks including Metro, RER, Buses, Trams and SNCF Overground Trains 3. Easiest and most flexible way to travel around Paris 4. No hassle of standing in queues to buy daily tickets, the Paris Visite Travelcard is your all-inclusive transport ticket 5. Travel any time of day, any day of the week
